notes.text:
An update for vim is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Vim (Vi IMproved) is an updated and improved version of the vi editor.

Security Fix(es):

* vim: Heap-based buffer overflow in block_insert() in src/ops.c (CVE-2022-0261)

* vim: Heap-based buffer overflow in utf_head_off() in mbyte.c (CVE-2022-0318)

* vim: Heap-based buffer overflow in init_ccline() in ex_getln.c (CVE-2022-0359)

* vim: Illegal memory access when copying lines in visual mode leads to heap buffer overflow (CVE-2022-0361)

* vim: Heap-based buffer overflow in getexmodeline() in ex_getln.c (CVE-2022-0392)

* vim: Use after free in src/ex_cmds.c (CVE-2022-0413)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A heap based out-of-bounds write flaw was found in vim's ops.c. This flaw allows an attacker to trick a user to open a crafted file triggering an out-of-bounds write. This vulnerability is capable of crashing software, modify memory, and possible code execution.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2022-0261 vim: Heap-based buffer overflow in block_insert() in src/ops.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 and 7 are not affected because the vulnerable code is not present in our code base.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
Untrusted vim scripts with -s [scriptin] are not recommended to run.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2022-0261 vim: Heap-based buffer overflow in block_insert() in src/ops.c

notes.text: A flaw was found in vim.  The vulnerability occurs due to reading beyond the end of a line in the utf_head_off function, which can lead to a heap buffer overflow. This flaw allows an attacker to input a specially crafted file, leading to a crash or code execution.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2022-0318 vim: Heap-based buffer overflow in utf_head_off() in mbyte.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
Untrusted vim scripts with -s [scriptin] are not recommended to run.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2022-0318 vim: Heap-based buffer overflow in utf_head_off() in mbyte.c

notes.text: A flaw was found in vim. The vulnerability occurs due to Illegal memory access with large 'tabstop' in Ex mode, which can lead to a heap buffer overflow. This flaw allows an attacker to input a specially crafted file, leading to a crash or code execution.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2022-0359 vim: Heap-based buffer overflow in init_ccline() in ex_getln.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
Untrusted vim scripts with -s [scriptin] are not recommended to run.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2022-0359 vim: Heap-based buffer overflow in init_ccline() in ex_getln.c

notes.text: A flaw was found in vim. The vulnerability occurs due to illegal memory access when copying lines in visual mode and leads to a heap buffer overflow. This flaw allows an attacker to input a specially crafted file, leading to a crash or code execution.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2022-0361 vim: Illegal memory access when copying lines in visual mode leads to heap buffer overflow
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
Untrusted vim scripts with -s [scriptin] are not recommended to run.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2022-0361 vim: Illegal memory access when copying lines in visual mode leads to heap buffer overflow

notes.text: A flaw was found in vim. The vulnerability occurs due to illegal memory access with bracketed paste in Ex mode and leads to a heap buffer overflow. This flaw allows an attacker to input a specially crafted file, leading to a crash or code execution.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2022-0392 vim: Heap-based buffer overflow in getexmodeline() in ex_getln.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
Untrusted vim scripts with -s [scriptin] are not recommended to run.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2022-0392 vim: Heap-based buffer overflow in getexmodeline() in ex_getln.c

notes.text: A flaw was found in vim. The vulnerability occurs due to using freed memory when the substitute uses a recursive function call, resulting in a use-after-free vulnerability. This flaw allows an attacker to input a specially crafted file, leading to a crash or code execution.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2022-0413 vim: Use after free in src/ex_cmds.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

Untrusted vim scripts with -s [scriptin] are not recommended to run.
